text: The peppered moth (Biston betularia) is a species of night-flying moth. They are often used by educators as an example of natural selection: see peppered moth evolution. The caterpillars of the peppered moth mimic the form and also the colour of the twig they rest on. The caterpillars can sense the twigâ€™s colour with their skin and match their body colour to the background to protect themselves from predators. == References == Category:Geometridae
title: Peppered moth
